page.title: 04EDUCATION IN CLAYBROOKE 1
page.content: Claybrooke Primary School (first built in 1813) caters for children in the two Claybrookes,Wibtoft, High Cross and Bittesby. Until 1976 children from Ullesthorpe (aged 8yrs) were transfered to Claybrooke School. However they have their own primary school(5-11). Frolesworth village school has long been demolished and the few children travel to a Broughton Astley primary school. At Claybrooke Primary School there are 76 pupils on roll and 4 teachers. They commence school at 5yrs and at 11 they transfer to the Lutterworth High School until they are 14yrs; then they continue their education at Lutterworth Grammar(Upper) School until 16 or 18yrs of age. This is the Leicestershire Plan Comprehensive System.
